Subject: 1.6 arcreader invocation script
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=6903103; y=nl8uDjlOmJn0D7L3RqxpxPH5az95SCY3h5ogX0sbMIKj-Ycc

The arcreader script in 1.6 in turn invokes the heritrix script, which
in turn looks to initialize JMX and all kinds of other noise that
doesn't apply when processing arc files. The upshot of this is that if
someone else on my machine wants to use arcreader they can't due to
permission problems related to jmxpassword and various other things.

Is there a good reason why a utility program is tied to the primary
heritrix invocation in this way? It's rather inconvenient.

    -tree
